p: The average expenditure on drugs (Rx and OTC from the pocket of a patient and payers) per capita in Poland is the lowest among OECD countries and in 2017 was 417 USD, with an average of 564 USD [ 19]. Only in a few countries is spending on drugs lower than in Poland. The situation may arise from the fact that overall health expenditure in Poland is lower than in other countries and also, because drugs in Poland are among the cheapest in Europe [ 16].
